lines.text:
[Referring to note in envelope]
It's for us all right. It says "for the g.d. sisters." I don't know if he means gold diggers or another well-known word.
You've been like a father.
I don't feel fatherly. I feel... uh, hotcha! That's it - hotcha!
You may not realize it, but there's something of a caveman in me.
That's what I'm afraid of, Kenneth
What now?
There's an old saying - when one fish gets away, bait your hook for another one.
I don't quite get you.
You're the bait. Before the sun sinks in the good old west, we'll bait another one.
I knew that if Daisy had to depend on her own brains, she'd be a flop.
Ah,yes, without your powerful mind, I guess we'd all be pretty well sunk.
I'm brainy enough to know when to run for cover. Let's start packing!
They'll grab us directly we make a move.
Listen, if I have a nervous breakdown over Daisy's disappearance, I could go to a New York sanitarium, and they wouldn't get wise.
If they ever get you under observation in a sanitarium, they'll probably keep you there.
And I'd probably feel right at home there after being around you.

[to Kay and June as they are leaving]
Oh, just a little parting advice - no one ever got in trouble by minding their own business.

[to Kay]
Every time you get an idea, I see jail bars closing around us.

[Handing him back a gun]
Thanks for the use of your bean shooter, Pop.
Too bad you're a woman. You'd make a great copper.
